classes

Class Strategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.Strategy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Basic, HiLo

    public abstract class Strategy
extends java.lang.Object
    The strategy class is the "interface" for both the basic and high-low strategies. It contains only one operation that is the choosing of the advice itself. The advice can use card counting tactics or not, and it's returned in the form of a String, e.g, "hit", "stand", "split", etc.

      • Strategy

        public Strategy(Hand h1,
                Hand h2)
        Constructor for the Strategy class. For the subclasses of this class this constructor is called to initialize the dealer's and player's hands.
        Parameters:

        h2 - player's hand

    • Method Detail

      • altStrategy

        java.lang.String altStrategy(Hand h)
        Strategy used when a split is the next best move but can't be performed. Hit if hand's value is bigger or equal to 17, stand otherwise. If it's a aces hand split the only option is to stand.
        Parameters:
        h - player's hand
        Returns:
        the next valid move

      • advice

        abstract java.lang.String advice(int dd,
                                 int in,
                                 int sp,
                                 int su)
        Receives the flags referring to the moves: double down, insure, split and surrender, and produces a string with the best move to be made, base on those flags. It's implemented in Basic and HiLo classes, and according to these strategies' "tables", it returns "hit", "stand", "split", etc., based on the best move to be made. This advice is used in simulation mode to ditacte the next move and in the interactive and debug modes to print in the terminal the next best move.
        Parameters:
        dd - 1 if possible to double down, 0 otherwise
        in - 1 if possible to insure, 0 otherwise
        sp - 1 if possible to split, 0 otherwise
        su - 1 if possible to surrender, 0 otherwise
        Returns:
        a string with the next move to be made, based on the tables and flags passed to the operation.
